args:
The pirate opera troupe's ship has been remodeled,
and the script decided upon. As Karina predicted,
practice for their original show has been going
smashingly—which means it's time to set sail!

The crew come to call at a lone island in a remote
region. When they inform the residents they'll be
performing a free opera, word spreads across the
island, packing the beach with spectators.
I came here because I heard an opera\nwould be performed, but I don't know how\nwe'll fit everyone onto that ship.
So we might not get to see it?
What's that?! It made that big noise\nwhen it came out of the ship!
It's a stage, dear—and I think they're\ngoing to perform on it!
What an amazing setup... Now everyone\nhere has a front-row seat to the show!
Hold, lass. Are ye sayin' you've already\nthought up a way to do this thing?
The biggest part of a ship is the hull,\nso we'll stash the stage in there.
Well, that'd let you fit a stage that's the\nsame size as the ship, all right—but\nwhere would your audience folks sit?
Outside! Ports and beaches can hold as\nmany people as we want, so long as we\ncan pull the ship close enough to shore.
Once we're in place, the stage slides out\nand everyone can enjoy the show!
The flashy mechanism for the stage has\ngot the audience stomping their feet...\nTalk about two gulls with one cannonball!
Slitherin' eels, they're mighty fired up!
Courage, you lily-livered sods! The most\nimportant thing for a pirate is courage!
B-but, Cap'n, what happens if I go out\nthere and flub me lines?
It went great in rehearsal, didn't it?\nSo quit worrying!
Have some confidence! You aren't any\nordinary pirates anymore, remember?
We're Karina's Pirate Opera Troupe,\nand we're so amazing that we can even\nimpress a weeping baby!
Yar, Cap'n Karina be right! That's why she\nbe writin' this opera just for us!
Let's DO this, ye dogs! We'll show them\nlandlubbers what ye get when a pirate\nsets their mind to somethin'!
Looks like you've found your guts at last.\nNow on with the show!
I am a princess in a cage...\nIt is a fate that makes me rage! ♪
The sky feels so very far away...\nI wish I could soar up there today... ♪
Poor thing, forced into a marriage\nshe didn't want... *sniff*
(Oh, we're drawing 'em in now!\nYou never can go wrong with a classic\ntragic heroine, am I right?)
(Ah, but, this show doesn't end in tragedy.\nFor you see...)
(...This show is based on MY life!)
But I spit in the eye of destiny...\nto forge a future made by me! ♪
I'll break my cage! Shatter my bars!\nAnd set out tonight for the stars! ♪
What's gonna happen to the princess?!
(What happens next, they ask? Well,\nsince this is my story, I happen to know...)
Ho lads, look there! A young lady fair!\nAll on her own, she hasn't a prayer! ♪
(Now THAT'S a great performance!\n'Course, they're pretty much playing\nthemselves, so I should expect greatness.)
Let's steal her away! Right this very day!\nWe'll hold her for ransom\nand make her folks pay! ♪
(Oh, this really takes me back. I remember\nbeing taken on board their ship and\nmeeting the original captain...)
Am I on a ship?! Are you pirates true?!\nToo bad—I'm still not afraid of you! ♪
Aye, pirates we be! Pirates most free!\nAnd pirates are always better than ye!
Free! Such a wonderful word!\nAlready I feel my heart stirred! ♪

Don't make light of us, lass!
Don't you dare poke fun!
'Cause pirates are terrors
who answer to none! ♪

If courage you want, I have it in spades!
I'll trade all I have in life for a blade!
Just let me come with you! Let me be free!
Let me have a life where I live as ME! ♪
Yar, she's a brave lass and blessed...\nBut can she pass the test?! ♪

We two will stand on the edge of the deck.
With sharks below ready to give us heck.
If I fall first, then a pirate you be...
But if you fall first, that's it for ye! ♪
A challenge most fair! A challenge so true!\nBut know that I'm going to defeat you! ♪

(Who would have thought a pirate wouldn't
know how to swim? But he was too full of
pride to back down, and in the end,
he tumbled into the sea.)
(But that's not part of the show today. It\njust wouldn't be right tossing him in the\nwater when he can't swim.)
('Bout time for the surrender then, Cap'n.\nAccordin' to the script.)
Sweet hardtack! He fell for real!
Yar, we be goin' off-book now!\nWhat do we do?!
Don't lose focus! The audience is watching!
Look, it doesn't matter if we're off-book,\nbecause this REALLY HAPPENED!\nJust remember it and run with it!
Yar, I just stood by watching nervously.\nI didn't have me the courage to leap into\nthe sea with all them sharks.
I'll take that as a yes. Now get your butt\nback on stage and finish this thing!
We'll go right into the finale!
What a relief! The sea dog's okay!\nI thought he'd meet Davy Jones today! ♪
This lass has beat me. This lass has won.\nWhich means she's captain now,\n'cause my time is done! ♪

All hail the new captain!
May she bring us all fame!
But please, O fair captain...
Please tell us your name! ♪
I am Captain Karina! Now weigh anchor!\nHoist the main! Mind the jib!\nThe Karina Pirates are setting out!
Gahaaar har har! Look there, boys!\nIt be Captain Karina and her crew!
Lady Luck be on our side, ye sods!\nTime to exact a little payback for what\nhappened to us last time!
Cap'n, look at the flag! It's those dogs we\nwiped the deck with last time, by gar!
They want revenge NOW?! We're just\nabout to finish the damn show!
This show is AMAZING! I can't believe\nthey have a second ship all ready to go!
Those other pirates are super yell-y...\nI'm scared! Waaaah!
That's it! I am NOT going to let these\nsoggy sods ruin my opera!
